definition: over and over again (idiom)
surname San
three/3
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort
surname Pan
five/5
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: Mother dings into her daughter the importance of hard study.
sentences.chinese: 母親三番五次地告誡她女兒要努力學習。

sentences.english: Why this fire incidents repeatedly happening in this steel factory ?…. Officials should seriously look into the matter….
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼這家鋼鐵廠三番五次發生火災事故？

sentences.english: I have talked about the topic again and again， so I don‘t want to speak it any more.
sentences.chinese: 這個話題我已經三番五次地說過，我不想再說了。

sentences.english: We've over and over again told you that everything must be done according to law.
sentences.chinese: 我們已三番五次告訴過你，幹什麼都得按法律辦事。

sentences.english: Want to run away GuKeSong three transgressions of five times along the way.
sentences.chinese: 古克松一路上三番五次的想逃跑。

sentences.english: One persistent lady to find were Samson's strength was.
sentences.chinese: 一個婦人三番五次去尋找參孫的長處。

sentences.english: He took advantage of her kindness and borrowed money from her too often.
sentences.chinese: 他利用了她的善良，三番五次地向她借錢。

sentences.english: I hate troubling him time and again.
sentences.chinese: 我不願意三番五次地麻煩他。

sentences.english: How could she when she betrayed him so badly?
sentences.chinese: 她三番五次地出賣他，怎麼可能是愛他呢？

definition: lit. twice then three times (idiom); fig. repeatedly/over and over again
again and again
pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1

definition: repeatedly
to put up innumerable obstacles/to create all kinds of difficulties (idiom)
to use all sorts of excuses
lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to urge sb on
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to be hard on sb/to deliberately make things difficult
in hundred and one ways/in every possible way/by every means
every few days (idiom)
more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
to be pestered beyond endurance
to be determined to/to insist on
to pester someone again and again
